msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; names of the donors; name of the protagonist (both Libanos and Mäṭaˤ); in Text I, groups of lines on the incipit page of the prologue (fol. 3r) and on the incipit page of the proper account (fol. 17r), and the incipit of some subsections; in Text II, groups of lines on the incipit page, and incipit of each miracle; in Text III, groups of lines on the incipit page and the word sälam (and its abbreviation); elements of the punctuation signs, text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

msItem.note: - For the Gädlä Libanos, Täʾamrä Libanos and Mälkǝʾa Libanos compare: A. BAUSI, La «Vita» e i «miracoli» di Libānos, Lovanii 2003 (CSCO 595, 596 [SAe 105, 106]).
- Text I.
Of this text, there are three different recensions (cp. Bausi 2003, XIII-XX):
1) GETATCHEW HAILE, “The Homily of Abba Elǝyas, Bishop of Aksum, on Mäṭṭa”, ABoll 108, 1990, 29-47.
2) ALESSANDRO BAUSI, La «Vita» e i «miracoli» di Libānos, Lovanii 2003a (CSCO 595, 596 [SAe 105, 106]), 1-72 [text] and 1-45 [tr.].
3)CARLO CONTI ROSSINI, “Il Gadla Libânos”, in: Ricordi di un soggiorno in Eritrea. Fascicolo Primo, Asmara 1903, 25-34.
The text inMGM-012seems more closed to the text as in the so called second recension, but with some more passages in the initial part.
Certainly, it is needed a further and accurate investigation.
The text is attributed to ʾElyas, the Bishop of Aksum (mention on fol. 17ra).
The text contains, on fols. 1ra-vb, a rhymed prologue:
በስመ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ፩አምላክ፨ በስመ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ አብ፡ ዘአምቅድመ፡ ዓለም፡ ህላዌሁ፨ ወእስከ፡ ለዓለም፡ ዘኢየሐልቅ፡ ምስፍናሁ። ልዑል፡ በልዕልናሁ፨ ስብሕ፡ በስብሐቲሁ፨ ...
- Text II.
The miracles are 11; with the exception of the miracle 1, all the others are wrongly numbered.

All the miracles are also contained in Bausi 2003 (s. above); here we give the correspondence as follows [on the left, the miracles in Ms.MGM-012, with the indication of the folios containing them; on the right, the miracles in Bausi’s edition, with the specific number and the equivalent number of the verse (§) given in the edition]:
Miracle 1 (fols. 46ra-46va) = Bausi, Miracle 2, §§203-204,206-207(without the additional passages found in Mss. AD = § 205)
Miracle 2 [numbered as 3] (fols. 46va-47va) = Bausi, Miracle 3, §§208-211
Miracle 3 [numbered as 4] (fols. 47va-48rb) = Bausi, Miracle 4, §§212-214
Miracle 4 [numbered as 5] (fols. 48rb-48va) = Bausi, Miracle 5, §§215-216
Miracle 5 [numbered as 6] (fols. 48va-49va) = Bausi, Miracle 6, §§217-221
Miracle 6 [numbered as 7] (fols. 49va-50rb) = Bausi, Miracle 7, §§222-225(without the additional passages found in Mss. AD = § 226)
Miracle 7 [numbered as 8] (fols. 50rb-50va) = Bausi, Miracle 8, §§227-228
Miracle 8 [numbered as 9] (fols. 50va-51rb) = Bausi, Miracle 10, §§251-255
Miracle 9 [numbered as 10] (fols. 51rb-52ra) = Bausi, Miracle 32 (372-374; inMGM-012, after § 374 only few lines are added)
Miracle 10 [numbered as 11] (fols. 52rb-52vb) = Bausi, Miracle 33, §§376-378
Miracle 11 [numbered as 12] (fols. 52vb-54ra) = Bausi, Miracle 11, §§256-261.
On fols. 45ra-46ra, the miracles are preceded by a praise in honour of the Saint (= Bausi, “Preambolo”, §§182-186).

supportDesc.condition: The original sewing is damaged. The Ms. was crudely resewn with recent threads. Both wooden boards are broken and repaired; the textile material which covers them has been crudely repaired with synthetic threads. Many folios are affected by humidity: e.g., fols. 16r, 17r, 37r, 46r-59v. Holes roughly amended on fols. 2, 5, 56, 57, 59.

- the crux ansata with coronis on fol. 14v.
